lines.gurmukhi: aulit pvn mn mIn kI cpl giq suKmnw sMgm kY bHm sQwn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Ulati Pavan Man Meen Kee Chapal Gati , Soukhamanaa Sangam Kai Braham Sadaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By the practice of Naam Simran, Guru-conscious disciples are able to control the wayward and frolicsome mind and with sharp fish-like movement harbour their consciousness in the Dasam Duar (tenth opening), the meeting place of Irha, Pingla and Sukhmana. T

lines.gurmukhi: swgr sill gih ggn Gtw GmMf aunmn mgn lgn gur igAwn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Saagar Salil Gahi Gagan Ghataa Ghamanda , Ounaman Magan Lagan Gur Giaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: With their consciousness resting in the Dasam Duar, they integrate themselves in the light eternal of the Lord just as the river merges with the water of the ocean. They remain in the ecstatic state of Naam Simran and all their interest and devotion remai

lines.gurmukhi: joiq mY joqI srUp dwmnI cmqkwr grjq Anhd sbd nIswn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Joti Mai Jotee Saroop Daamanee Chamatakaara , Garajat Anahad Sabad Neesaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By melding into the super radiance of the Lord, they enjoy the blissful electric radiance of the union. They hear the sound of unstruck music loud and clear.

lines.gurmukhi: inJr Apwr Dwr brKw AMmiRq jl syvk skl Pl srb inDwn hY ]59]
lines.transliteration_english: Nijhar Apaar Dhaar Barakhaa Anmrit Jala , Sayvak Sakal Dhal Sarab Nidhaan Hai ?59?

Shabad OS B.translation: They perpetually enjoy the continuous flow of the divine elixir in the Dasam Duar and the seekers obtain all the fruits and treasures. (59)
